I donâ€™t know his name. I could ask for it.
If APS is anything like CPS, Iâ€™m not sure what they could do. (Bad experience as a child)

Sorry. I didnâ€™t realize this was a joke sub. ğŸ˜‚

Maybe I need to get checked....

I had an MRI of my spine that showed disc herniation, moderate spinal stenosis, bone spurs, and a cyst in my spine.

My left arm always had arthritis due to a previous fracture. It was only later this year when my right hand started getting stiffness mostly in my index and middle finger. So I saw my primary where he looked at the back MRI and now these new symptoms. Back when the MRI was done, I did not have work and it happened randomly with no explanation. He suggested to see the rheumatologist and sent the referral.

Iâ€™ve saw the rheumatologist but no diagnosis yet as I feel like itâ€™s just wait and watch thing right now. I was prescribed vitamin D and a NSAID. I go back later this week and we will see what happens, but my SED rate was elevated and other blood was fine last time.

I feel this on an everyday basis. Even before the crisis, my personality has been considered laid back.

Not a good day at work? No big deal, do your best and go home. I see coworkers suffering from a lot of stress and donâ€™t see myself getting too deep into stress about small things as my early life was just one traumatic event after another.

Thank you for the inspiration.

I feel like my parents would rather me be happy than stressed. Iâ€™m definitely wouldnâ€™t be described as lazy. When things get out-of-hand, I just need to rest. I have a full-time job and my own household to care for (no children; but animals). I think only getting a degree would just give me a fancy paper. I donâ€™t mind where I work, but I like to learn new things in general.

Thank you.

Iâ€™m sure my nerves being shocked during childhood done a lot of damage to my body.

I remember being 9 years old (this was after the most traumatic event) my stomach hurt so bad and a doctor said itâ€™s from stress and to be careful with it. A lot of the stress was beyond my control so now here I am.

Not my parents as they passed away when I was young, but family members cared for me.

I kinda explained it in a different thread so hereâ€™s copy and paste:


I also remember as a teen expressing â€œmy back hurtsâ€ to my family. They would tell me drink more water because itâ€™s probably a kidney infection. After I was 19, I decided to go to the doctor about it. I was nervous because I was used to believing that it was nothing and pretty sure they wouldnâ€™t find anything.

Doctor says â€œwtf did you do???â€. I really donâ€™t know doc. It just randomly happened. Now seeing a rheumatologist. I hope I finally get answers after so many years.

My foot numbness has came back after years of not having it. Thankfully I see the rheumatologist again soon. I have lived with the concept that itâ€™s been in my head until I actually had the MRI of my spine and the doctor was even shocked. I donâ€™t have an official dx to why yet.

Itâ€™s not even about the pain. I lived with it so long so itâ€™s normal but exhausting. I want to know WHY. If itâ€™s something thatâ€™s degenerative like an autoimmune disease (my primary doctor believes it could be RA) to get treatment to prevent further damage.

I want to know the reason behind the pain not to really â€œcureâ€ the pain, but to stop any further damage.

I have a whole host of other issues as well involving gastrointestinal, gynecological, and mental health issues from past trauma. I havenâ€™t really went in depth with the other issues besides mental health. I had a CT of my abdomen once (with and without contrast) and wasnâ€™t anything significant, so I just gave up with that and think maybe itâ€™s nothing.

I too have moderate lumber spinal stenosis along with bone spurs and a cyst in the spine (also cysts always on my ovaries). Oh and herniation.

My hands are also going stiff and dropping things a lot.

â€œToo young for these issuesâ€ -other adults

I also remember as a teen expressing â€œmy back hurtsâ€ to my family. They would tell me drink more water because itâ€™s probably a kidney infection. After I was 19, I decided to go to the doctor about it. I was nervous because I was used to believing that it was nothing and pretty sure they wouldnâ€™t find anything.

Doctor says â€œwtf did you do???â€.
I really donâ€™t know doc. It just randomly happened. Now seeing a rheumatologist. I hope I finally get answers after so many years.

I thought losing weight would help so here I am 50 pounds later and now Iâ€™m having more symptoms.

The walking part my be â€œtrueâ€ if you are like me and the pain is extreme in the mornings and after about an hour or so of being up it becomes manageable.

BUT

Not everyone is the same. There are different types of chronic pain from different causes.
I had a customer say they had the same problem, but was cured from avoiding gluten.
â€œDo some stretchesâ€

Yes.

My back according to the doctor â€œis like an 80 year oldâ€.

On the outside I look younger than my actual age of 24 and on the inside Iâ€™m an old lady.

I hurt every day and some days more than others. I try not to show it in person as â€œIâ€™m too young for such issuesâ€.

Iâ€™m not supposed to lift over 30 pounds according to the doctor. Iâ€™m scared of asking for help because Iâ€™ll get weird looks. I know older coworkers have medical restrictions to sit and all, but feel like if I try to do that they will find a way to fire me. My closest coworker understands, but I feel like no one will understand fully. The pain is invisible on the outside and quite frankly I cannot accurately explain the extent of the pain as it has become the norm over the years. I feel like I cannot express the pain to the doctor accurately. I broke my arm and didnâ€™t really flinch so not sure if itâ€™s a high pain tolerance or being so used to pain or a mix of both. I try not expressing the pain a lot as I feel like itâ€™s just â€œcrying wolfâ€, but itâ€™s painful every day and varies day by day. I feel alone because Iâ€™m stuck in questioning if the pain is just normal and wonder how what everyone else feels compared to me. 

Sorry Iâ€™m in an emotional mood today because of it. Iâ€™ve been thinking a lot about it.

YTA.

Iâ€™m sorry. I like video games and slacking as well, but can still manage working full-time and do chores on top of chronic medical issues.
NTA spend time with your mother please. PLEASE. Two years? Iâ€™m in a relationship for 8 years and this wouldnâ€™t even be an argument. Just a â€œAwesome have fun!â€

Iâ€™ve lost both of my parents before the age of 18. I wasnâ€™t there to say a final goodbye. It hurts sometimes.

If SO left me alone in basically a serious medical procedure especially a risky situation for two people (mother and baby) to let a coworker be with their dying grandpa, this will be a forever and maybe every day hurt compared to the once of the blue moon thought of â€œI didnâ€™t even say goodbye to my parentsâ€. This would just be even without the prior past traumas from childbirth and without the factor of it being a female coworker.
I have stenosis in my lower spine.

Iâ€™m not dx with bpd (24;F), but maybe see a new psych or find a different means of communication. I couldnâ€™t effectively communicate my issues and found that writing everything down and letting the doctor read it was better. 

Iâ€™ve struggled with mental health and had my first hospitalization when I was about 13 or 14 due to a psychotic break. After 18, I was in and out of the hospital frequently because of self harm and suicide attempts.

I had to drop out of school several times, and honestly I am about to do it again as this year is just a bad year in general. I am in the process of getting my chronic health problems finally sorted out. I am working full-time and was doing the school online. I thought I could do it but the events of this year (several deaths and general chaos from COVID-19) have taken its toll. I am tired of not having time to relax because after work I have the school work. Then trying to juggle the chronic pain and intense flare ups. New symptoms pop up and I canâ€™t readily see the doctor from the virus (thank god I finally have an appointment in a couple of weeks). I feel like a failure because I promised my dad I would go to college (he is deceased now). 

You are valid to have the extra feelings of sadness because being diagnosed with a life changing dx can cause trauma. Grieving over your old self. If they chalk it up to the bpd, then find a new doctor because medical conditions are really stressful for anyone.

If you are operating a register, do not let customers bully you how to work it. If thereâ€™s a problem or just uncomfortable, call a manager.

Never hit cash if thereâ€™s no cash involved. I just end up playing dumb and call a manager.

I did loss prevention for a bit. They like target young cashiers. I just havenâ€™t aged since I was 12 years old. If someone tries to act like they know what theyâ€™re doing then they should get a job here (in the older ladyâ€™s case, go back to work).
Older lady and young lady

I think thatâ€™s why too. I did research (actually just googled) why and says something like hormones are to blame. I could have endometriosis too, but take birth control. My periods before birth control was horrible. My lumbar spine is pretty messed up and ouch the period adds to it. I rather tough out the pain because the NSAIDs end up killing my stomach in the long run and peptic ulcers are no fun. I just want the degeneration to stop as Iâ€™m only in my 20s and people keep saying â€œoh just wait until youâ€™re olderâ€.
Iâ€™ve been dropping things lately. More and more.
Maâ€™am go to the bathroom and wash your hands with soap and water.

My regular sent me to the rheumatologist because my back is like an 80 year old and I was like â€œWhy?? I donâ€™t know how it even messed up in the first placeâ€

Also, other symptoms popped up like my fingers and hands were getting stiff.

So my regular doctor said â€œif you were an older person it would be common to have the problems but since youâ€™re young it definitely needs further investigationâ€.

This is from years of back pain and now my hands are stiff and crunchy (mostly index right now). I seen the rheumatologist and he doesnâ€™t have a definite answer yet. Iâ€™ve had more symptoms pop up and Iâ€™ll see the rheumatologist next week.

Maybe ask for a referral to a rheumatologist for another opinion? Or maybe a different primary?

I never seen a problem with Mormons just associated it another denomination until a family member had a legit mental breakdown down because of a sibling married a lady that is Mormon and somehow convinced the sibling into becoming Mormon.

I still donâ€™t understand how it caused the family member to have that extreme of reaction to a sibling converting to a different religion.

I met this lady and she seems alright. Iâ€™ve been around her whole family and they were kind of weird and didnâ€™t talk to me but whatever. I got the judging vibes from them.

But itâ€™s the same around other religious people. There are some genuinely nice religious people, but a lot of the church goers play a â€œniceâ€ persona with the feeling of intense judgement underlying the â€œniceâ€.

I have family members who are pastors and never got the judgement vibes from them, but Iâ€™ve been to churches where Iâ€™ve experienced it and it would be mostly by other church goers than the pastors themselves.

I think itâ€™s kinda weird that Mormons also follow another book, but I just find it weird in the context of â€œugh something else to readâ€.

But the response the church gave to asexuality throws me off from the churches Iâ€™ve experienced. As if you say something like â€œI donâ€™t have sexual attractionâ€, they say it is a blessing that you donâ€™t experience lustful thinking.

Fun thing Iâ€™ve experienced, I went to a Pentecostal church with a friend and didnâ€™t experience judgement even though I was wearing my jeans, but they are wild in service and kinda terrifying as it was full of crying and screaming. Iâ€™m introverted in general and was concerned and confused. They had a lot of food to eat afterwards though.

Interested in me? No, no, no. Iâ€™m not interested in THEM.

Just in the chart he even told the nurse â€œNever had kids. Doesnâ€™t want kidsâ€. Iâ€™m having female issues so I think tubal ligation is a better option and an opportunity to explore my insides further.

Itâ€™s not that I hate kids. Iâ€™m just awkward with them. I grew up without my mom (passed away at a young age) and itâ€™s a foreign concept to me honestly. Also, I have to take medication for mental and physical health disorders. Another thing is that I can barely take care of myself.

Iâ€™m not sure what Mormons believe really. I feel like this is an opportunity to ask questions about it and hopefully with no offense (considering the response from the church was offensive). Iâ€™m just genuinely curious. A lot of these might be stereotypical so I want to apologize in advance for it.

-Iâ€™ve heard that in the religion that husbands will have more than one wives, is that true?

-Growing up I know some classmates that were involved in the religion and remember one wasnâ€™t allowed to have soda. Not sure if it was religion based, but I also had a teacher say caffeine isnâ€™t allowed.

-I know someone who swears the church is a literal cult. They told me that when they die they believe going into space and wear a white suit for their burial.

Just a general explanation please.

I grew up in a Christian based atmosphere (mostly of the Baptist denomination). It was expressed that even looking at someone with lust was adulterous. I forgot the exact verse but basically if you look with lust to gouge your eye out. So Iâ€™m sure if a email asking about asexual would give a whole different response than this.

I donâ€™t go to church anymore. I just live life and I donâ€™t think about religion enough to place myself in a group like agnostic or atheism. Itâ€™s not even a thought most of the time. Working retail is fun because Iâ€™ve had customers approach me asking â€œif Iâ€™ve been saved and go to churchâ€. I just tell them â€œyes and yesâ€. Then theyâ€™ll leave me alone.
I am qualified bad at humaning.

â€œAre you fat?â€

My thyroid hormones are fine with last blood work. I have had chronic bowel issues. Can go from constipation to diarrhea in no time. Sometimes both at the same time. Occasionally, I have vagal responses to the bowel movements. 

The bowel issues were somewhat investigated. I had a CT scan with and without contrast with nothing significant other than constipation and â€œoh you have an ovarian cystâ€. 

I was considered obese before losing weight. Prior to gaining weight I couldnâ€™t gain until a medication did it. Off the medication around 2017 or 2018. I do take medication for a ADD, but I donâ€™t think it could cause the significant loss unless my metabolism finally went to prior to the weight gaining medication. I just donâ€™t have a viable explanation for people asking what I did to lose it. Kinda ridiculous how people keep asking for tips.

I did call the primary first today. The office lady was rude and kept empathizing â€œheâ€™s only do phone consults but heâ€™s out of the office blah blah blahâ€. I really donâ€™t care about the phone consult I just want to know why my foot is going numb again. So I called the rheumatologist office and the office lady was much nicer. However, he is pretty booked due to having to see less patients (which is very understandable). My appointment is the 6th, but will call if thereâ€™s a cancellation.
